com.mesosphere.sdk.storage

Class PersisterCache

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.mesosphere.sdk.storage.PersisterCache
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Persister

    public class PersisterCache
extends java.lang.Object
implements Persister
    A transparent write-through cache for an underlying Persister instance. Each cache instance is thread-safe, but there is no guarantee of consistent behavior across multiple cache instances.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      PersisterCache(Persister persister)

      Returns the names of child nodes at the provided path.
      java.util.Map<java.lang.String,byte[]> getMany(java.util.Collection<java.lang.String> paths)
      Atomically reads many values from storage at once, returning a mapping of paths to values.
      void recursiveDelete(java.lang.String path)
      Recursively deletes the data at the specified path, or throws an exception if no data existed at that location.
      void recursiveDeleteMany(java.util.Collection<java.lang.String> paths)
      Atomically deletes many values from storage at once, with each path entry being treated as a call to Persister.recursiveDelete(String) for those paths.
      void refresh()
      Refreshes the cache with the underlying persister's data.

      Writes a single value to storage at the specified path, replacing any existing data at the path or creating the path if it doesn't exist yet.
      void setMany(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,byte[]> pathBytesMap)
      Atomically writes many values to storage at once.

    • Method Detail

      • get

        public byte[] get(java.lang.String path)
           throws PersisterException
        Description copied from interface: Persister
        Retrieves the previously stored data at the specified path, or throws an exception if the path doesn't exist. If the path is valid but has no data (i.e. is a parent of another path), this returns null.
        Specified by:
        get in interface Persister
        Throws:
        PersisterException - if the requested path doesn't exist, or for other access errors

      • getChildren

        public java.util.Collection<java.lang.String> getChildren(java.lang.String path)
                                                   throws PersisterException
        Description copied from interface: Persister
        Returns the names of child nodes at the provided path. Some returned nodes may have null data when retrieved via Persister.get(String), indicating that these are stub parent entries to other nodes.

        To translate the returned values to full absolute paths, they may be joined with the provided path input using PersisterUtils.join(String, String).

        To get the list of nodes at the root, use "" or "/" as the input path.

        Specified by:
        getChildren in interface Persister
        Throws:
        PersisterException - if the requested path doesn't exist, or for other access errors

      • set

        public void set(java.lang.String path,
                byte[] bytes)
         throws PersisterException
        Description copied from interface: Persister
        Writes a single value to storage at the specified path, replacing any existing data at the path or creating the path if it doesn't exist yet.
        Specified by:
        set in interface Persister
        Throws:
        PersisterException - in the event of an access error

      • getMany

        public java.util.Map<java.lang.String,byte[]> getMany(java.util.Collection<java.lang.String> paths)
                                               throws PersisterException
        Description copied from interface: Persister
        Atomically reads many values from storage at once, returning a mapping of paths to values. Values which are missing will be set to null in the returned Map.
        Specified by:
        getMany in interface Persister
        Throws:
        PersisterException - in the event of an access error
        See Also:
        Persister.get(String)

             throws PersisterException
        Description copied from interface: Persister
        Atomically writes many values to storage at once.
        Specified by:
        setMany in interface Persister
        Throws:
        PersisterException - in the event of an access error, in which case no changes should have been made
        See Also:

      • recursiveDeleteMany

        public void recursiveDeleteMany(java.util.Collection<java.lang.String> paths)
                         throws PersisterException
        Description copied from interface: Persister
        Atomically deletes many values from storage at once, with each path entry being treated as a call to Persister.recursiveDelete(String) for those paths.
        Specified by:
        recursiveDeleteMany in interface Persister
        Throws:
        PersisterException - in the event of an access error, in which case no changes should have been made
        See Also:
        Persister.recursiveDelete(String)

      • recursiveDelete

        public void recursiveDelete(java.lang.String path)
                     throws PersisterException
        Description copied from interface: Persister
        Recursively deletes the data at the specified path, or throws an exception if no data existed at that location.

        Deleting the root node (as "" or "/") will result in all nodes EXCEPT the root node being deleted.

        Specified by:
        recursiveDelete in interface Persister
        Throws:
        PersisterException - if the data at the requested path didn't exist, or for other access errors

      • close

        public void close()
        Description copied from interface: Persister
        Closes this storage and cleans up any local client resources. No other operations should be performed against the instance after calling this.
        Specified by:
        close in interface Persister

      • refresh

        public void refresh()
             throws PersisterException
        Refreshes the cache with the underlying persister's data.
        Throws:
        PersisterException
